snippet: Bombings and shootings took the lives of at least 43 Afghans on Tuesday. The assaults came as people were thronging shops to prepare for the Muslim holiday that ends the month of Ramadan.
abstract: Bombings and shootings take the lives of at least 43 Afghans around the country in deadliest day for civilians this year; insurgents had struck while people thronged shops to prepare for the Muslim holiday that ends the month of Ramadan.

byline.contributor: Sangar Rahimi, Jawad Sukhanyar and Habib Zahori contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Bombings and shootings took the lives of at least 43 Afghans on Tuesday. The assaults came as people were thronging shops to prepare for the Muslim holiday that ends the month of Ramadan.

headline.seo: Attackers in Afghanistan Kill at Least 43
headline.main: Afghan Attacks Kill Dozens in Deadliest Day for Civilians This Year
headline.print_headline: Attacks, Including One Partly Thwarted, Bring Deadliest Day for Afghan Civilians
